posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.86 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

This release includes two notable changes: a Liquid Glass redesign, and group polls!

Release notes:

  • Signal polls are here! Are you and your friends on the same page, or are you poll-ar opposites? Polls are an easy way to see what your group chat really thinks. Create a poll with competing dinner options, vacation destinations, musical preferences for an upcoming road trip, or any other important choices. Everyone in the group can vote and see each other’s responses, and you can decide whether or not to allow multiple votes.

  • This update also includes the first wave of the Liquid Glass redesign for iOS 26 and iPadOS 26 with refined animations and new visual elements. Future releases will have even more improvements, but if you’re thirsty for a new look then this Liquid Glass should already be pretty refreshing.

Liquid Glass

This is the first version of our Liquid Glass redesign, available to users on iOS 26. We’ve improved several parts of our app with a fresh coat of paint, new animations, and a lot of Liquid Glass. Give it a shot: play around with chat wallpapers, the now-dynamic message input bar, a refreshed attachment picker, and much more!

Notably, we have not yet applied the new styling to every screen in the app: for example, our calling UI, the media viewer, navigation/tabs on iPad, and in-chat banners. We plan to continue improvements in future releases!

We’re excited to finally share these features with you all, and we look forward to your feedback!

When reporting issues, please include which iOS 26 version you’re running – 26.0, 26.1, and 26.2 all had different known issues on Apple’s side.

Backups

Finally, with this release we’re continuing our TestFlight-exclusive testing of Backups. See the beta release post for 7.79 for more details.

Please continue to report any issues you encounter! When reporting issues, please include debug logs and screenshots if applicable; if you’re experiencing a crash, please also include .ips files. Instructions can be found here.

Thank you all, as always, for helping us improve Signal!

New Version: 7.87.0.1203-beta

103 new commits since 7.86.0.1196-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.87 [1]

  • Fix loop when cleaning up view once messages [2]

  • Partially revert "Fix build warnings from XCode 9." [3]

  • Use random bytes for attributes change token [4]

  • Use random bytes for profile rotation token [5]

  • Remove appForegroundTime property [6]

  • Post a notification when lastBackupDate changes [7]

  • Consolidate "last Backup details" into LastBackupDetails [8]

  • Tweaks to BackupExportJob [9]

  • Use same timestamp for LastBackupDetails as in Backup header [10]

  • Fix "suggested stickers" panel becomes misplaced after backgrounding the app. [11]

  • Remove unnecessary code from BackupArchiveManager [12]

  • Remove unused video compression method [13]

  • Remove unused video-related methods [14]

  • Launch SDSDB into the sun [15]

  • Simplify video trimming logic; remove unused code [16]

  • Throw errors in fileSize(of: …) [17]

  • Remove various path-related wrappers from String [18]

  • Assume we have a PNI identity key [19]

  • Fix handling for background fetches that finish [20]

  • Fix date calculation during background fetches [21]

  • Remove some shims [22]

  • Tweaks for chat input bar. [23]

  • Fix error when compressed video is too large [24]

  • Remove unused moveToUrlAndConsume method [25]

  • Remove “unknown” mime type [26]

  • Schema for pinned messages [27]

  • Reduce subscription-related jitter in BackupSettings [28]

  • Add icon to pinned messages [29]

  • Fix poll long press [30]

  • Give selected chats on iPad in split view configuration a special treatment. […] [31]

  • Add dynamic color support for the "No Access To Photos" UI in attachment menu. [32]

  • Remove GroupCallTooltip [33]

  • Simplify error handling for large recorded videos [34]

  • Un-consolidate video validation methods [35]

  • Remove unnecessary video validation code [36]

  • Remove SignalAttachment.dataSource wrappers [37]

  • Make SignalAttachment’s dataSource non-Optional [38]

  • Require Memoji to be images [39]

  • Prefer strongly-typed SignalAttachment methods [40]

  • Remove redundant check for compressing videos [41]

  • Reuse videoAttachment method after compressing [42]

  • Require DataSourcePath when compressing videos [43]

  • Don’t specify dataUTI when compressing videos [44]

  • Remove isVideoThatNeedsCompression [45]

  • Clean up file provider document handling [46]

  • Measure video transcode/render performance [47]

  • Clean up ForwardMessageItem & friends [48]

  • De-protocolize & move SignalAttachmentCloner [49]

  • Use DataSourcePath explicitly for a few uploads [50]

  • More tweaks to chat list displayed in split view mode. [51]

  • Layout tweaks for call list when displayed in split view mode. […] [52]

  • Add timer to poll end info message [53]

  • Sort remote configs [54]

  • De-protocolize & de-shim EditManager [55]

  • Change end-poll weight for long press menu [56]

  • More precisely decide which notifications to clear on app activate [57]

  • Remove unnecessary code from ConversationSettings, OWSTableViewController2 [58]

  • Remove DeleteForMeInfoSheetCoordinator [59]

  • Fix long press for end poll part 2 [60]

  • Fix mention picker too wide in iPhone landscape and on iPad. [61]

  • Make the Registration splash an OWSNavigationChildController [62]

  • Limit video size checks to 1 Hz while recording [63]

  • Use constant overhead for video recording teardown [64]

  • Use remote config for video recording size limit [65]

  • Add assertion for aspect ratio validity [66]

  • Reduce duplication with video recording file type [67]

  • Update attachment menu top inset from 40 to 36. [68]

  • Optimize attachment picker for compact vertical size class environments. […] [69]

  • Do not reset scroll position in the attachment menu between presentations. [70]

  • Implement new design for chat view banners. [71]

  • Downgrade early message assertions to warnings [72]

  • Update header padding on forward sheet [73]

  • App icon tweaks [74]

  • Only attempt deleting Backup when deleting account if Backups are enabled [75]

  • Remove payments from attachment menu if they aren't activated [76]

  • Fix end poll icon name [77]

  • Handle early poll terminate [78]

  • Drafts with non-contacts don't show up in chat list [79]

  • Improvements to chat CV gesture recognizer logic. […] [87]

  • Explicitly call ConversationInputToolbar.scrollToBottom. […] [88]

  • Improvements to long text view controller. […] [89]

  • Layout tweaks for stories lists when displayed in split view mode. […] [90]

  • Stop re-creating ConversationInputToolbar on theme change. […] [91]

  • Improve Dynamic Type support in chat input bar. […] [92]

  • Use typed throws when removing image metadata [93]

  • Some love for sticker pack view. […] [94]

  • Give selected rows in chat list search results special treatment when in sidebar. [95]

  • Update Linked Devices header string [96]

  • Remove verbose log line [97]

  • Show WelcomeToBackups when reenabling, but not when upgrading [98]

  • Rotate uploadEra when disabling Backups [99]

  • Only run list-media on paid-tier primaries [100]

  • Avoid infinite-retries of fatal errors in in ListMediaManager [101]

  • Rotate uploadEra when BackupPlan becomes "paid" [102]

  • Update translations [103]

posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
A couple question to help us narrow this down

  1. Is this a stock iOS keyboard?
  2. Does this happen every time you bring up the keyboard?
  3. And/or does this happen in every chat?
  4. Does this happen in other apps?

Unfortunately, my guess is this is an issue more related to the iOS beta, but it would be good to try an narrow that down.

posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
No, this isn’t expected behavior

  • Did you choose to transfer messages history to the iPad when linking?
  • Is ‘Screen Lock’ enabled on your primary device?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: No to both. I’m linking it to a standard Android client.

Why obsolete changelog again?

Signal Polls are already out.
”TestFlight-exclusive testing of Backups” …?

Just put in “general improvements, bugfixes“ or something, please.

Android version can do that.

Following up on Backups ( Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.86 release - #82 by sashaweiss-signal )

WhatsApp daily backups ran. Signal still doesn’t backup. It’s worth noting that WhatsApp backed up throughout the day (shortly after I opened WhatsApp a backup started) and didn’t seem to have a specific criteria when to start.
